verses.plain: Hear ye this word which I take up against you, even a lamentation, O house of Israel.

tokens.t: Hear ye this word which I take up against you,
a lamentation, O house of Israel.

verses.plain: The virgin of Israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: she is forsaken upon her land; there is none to raise her up.

tokens.t: The virgin of Israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: she is forsaken upon her land;
none to raise her up.

verses.plain: For thus saith the Lord GOD; The city that went out by a thousand shall leave an hundred, and that which went forth by an hundred shall leave ten, to the house of Israel.

tokens.t: For thus saith the Lord
; The city that went out
a thousand shall leave an hundred, and that which went forth
an hundred shall leave ten, to the house of Israel.

verses.plain: ¶ For thus saith the LORD unto the house of Israel, Seek ye me, and ye shall live:

tokens.t: ¶ For thus saith the
unto the house of Israel, Seek ye me, and ye shall live:

verses.plain: But seek not Beth-el, nor enter into Gilgal, and pass not to Beer-sheba: for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Beth-el shall come to nought.

tokens.t: But seek not Beth-el, nor enter into Gilgal, and pass not to Beer-sheba: for Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, and Beth-el shall come to nought.

verses.plain: Seek the LORD, and ye shall live; lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and devour it, and there be none to quench it in Beth-el.

tokens.t: Seek the
, and ye shall live; lest he break out like fire in the house of Joseph, and devour
, and
none to quench
in Beth-el.

verses.plain: Ye who turn judgment to wormwood, and leave off righteousness in the earth,

tokens.t: Ye who turn judgment to wormwood, and leave off righteousness in the earth,

verses.plain: Seek him that maketh the seven stars and Orion, and turneth the shadow of death into the morning, and maketh the day dark with night: that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The LORD is his name:

tokens.t: that maketh the seven stars and Orion, and turneth the shadow of death into the morning, and maketh the day dark with night: that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth: The
his name:

verses.plain: That strengtheneth the spoiled against the strong, so that the spoiled shall come against the fortress.

tokens.t: That strengtheneth the spoiled against the strong, so that the spoiled shall come against the fortress.

verses.plain: They hate him that rebuketh in the gate, and they abhor him that speaketh uprightly.

tokens.t: They hate him that rebuketh in the gate, and they abhor him that speaketh uprightly.

verses.plain: Forasmuch therefore as your treading is upon the poor, and ye take from him burdens of wheat: ye have built houses of hewn stone, but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have planted pleasant vineyards, but ye shall not drink wine of them.

tokens.t: Forasmuch therefore as your treading
upon the poor, and ye take from him burdens of wheat: ye have built houses of hewn stone, but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have planted pleasant vineyards, but ye shall not drink wine of them.

verses.plain: For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they afflict the just, they take a bribe, and they turn aside the poor in the gate from their right.

tokens.t: For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they afflict the just, they take a bribe, and they turn aside the poor in the gate

verses.plain: Therefore the prudent shall keep silence in that time; for it is an evil time.

tokens.t: Therefore the prudent shall keep silence in that time; for it
an evil time.

verses.plain: Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live: and so the LORD, the God of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken.

tokens.t: Seek good, and not evil, that ye may live: and so the
, the God of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken.

verses.plain: Hate the evil, and love the good, and establish judgment in the gate: it may be that the LORD God of hosts will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph.

tokens.t: Hate the evil, and love the good, and establish judgment in the gate: it may be that the
God of hosts will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph.

verses.plain: Therefore the LORD, the God of hosts, the Lord, saith thus; Wailing shall be in all streets; and they shall say in all the highways, Alas! alas! and they shall call the husbandman to mourning, and such as are skilful of lamentation to wailing.

tokens.t: Therefore the
, the God of hosts, the Lord, saith thus; Wailing
in all streets; and they shall say in all the highways, Alas! alas! and they shall call the husbandman to mourning, and such as are skilful of lamentation to wailing.

verses.plain: And in all vineyards shall be wailing: for I will pass through thee, saith the LORD.

tokens.t: And in all vineyards
wailing: for I will pass through thee, saith the

verses.plain: Woe unto you that desire the day of the LORD! to what end is it for you? the day of the LORD is darkness, and not light.

tokens.t: Woe unto you that desire the day of the
! to what end
it for you? the day of the
darkness, and not light.

verses.plain: As if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; or went into the house, and leaned his hand on the wall, and a serpent bit him.

tokens.t: As if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; or went into the house, and leaned his hand on the wall, and a serpent bit him.

verses.plain: Shall not the day of the LORD be darkness, and not light? even very dark, and no brightness in it?

tokens.t: not the day of the
darkness, and not light? even very dark, and no brightness in it?

verses.plain: ¶ I hate, I despise your feast days, and I will not smell in your solemn assemblies.

tokens.t: ¶ I hate, I despise your feast days, and I will not smell in your solemn assemblies.

verses.plain: Though ye offer me burnt offerings and your meat offerings, I will not accept them: neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat beasts.

tokens.t: Though ye offer me burnt offerings and your meat offerings, I will not accept
neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat beasts.

verses.plain: Take thou away from me the noise of thy songs; for I will not hear the melody of thy viols.

tokens.t: Take thou away from me the noise of thy songs; for I will not hear the melody of thy viols.

verses.plain: But let judgment run down as waters, and righteousness as a mighty stream.

tokens.t: But let judgment run down as waters, and righteousness as a mighty stream.

verses.plain: Have ye offered unto me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?

tokens.t: Have ye offered unto me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?

verses.plain: But ye have borne the tabernacle of your Moloch and Chiun your images, the star of your god, which ye made to yourselves.

tokens.t: But ye have borne the tabernacle of your Moloch and Chiun your images, the star of your god, which ye made to yourselves.

verses.plain: Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith the LORD, whose name is The God of hosts.

tokens.t: Therefore will I cause you to go into captivity beyond Damascus, saith the
, whose name
The God of hosts.

footnotes.text: the tabernacle…: or, Siccuth your king
